Nevertheless, it may be sufficient to return only approximate partial size (low end approximation) as long as the layout manager knows that the item (content being measured) will exceed current page dimensions ( for more details) for the current target device and a complete accurate measurement of the item is expensive.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType
member.summary: Defines the geometry types according to OGC Simple Access specification.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType.Point
member.summary: 0-dimensional geometric object and represents a single location in coordinate space.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType.LineString
member.summary: Curve with linear interpolation between Points.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType.Polygon
member.summary: Planar Surface defined by 1 exterior boundary and 0 or more interior boundaries.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType.MultiPoint
member.summary: 0-dimensional GeometryCollection.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType.MultiLineString
member.summary: MultiCurve whose elements are LineStrings.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType.MultiPolygon
member.summary: MultiSurface whose elements are Polygons.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType.GeometryCollection
member.summary: Geometric object that is a collection of some number of geometric objects.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType.CircularString
member.summary: The CircularString is the basic curve type, similar to a LINESTRING in the linear world. A single segment required three points, the start and end points (first and third) and any other point on the arc.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType.CompoundCurve
member.summary: A compound curve is a single, continuous curve that has both curved (circular) segments and linear segments.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType.CurvePolygon
member.summary: A CurvePolygon is just like a polygon, with an outer ring and zero or more inner rings. The difference is that a ring can take the form of a circular string, linear string or compound string.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType.MultiCurve
member.summary: 1-dimensional GeometryCollection whose elements are Curves.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Extensibility.Rendering.Components.Map.GeoData.GeometryType.MultiSurface
member.summary: 2-dimensional GeometryCollection whose elements are Surfaces.
